entities.characters

Class Char

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
      • entities.characters.AbstractChar
        • entities.characters.Char

  • public class Char
extends AbstractChar
    This is the class that instantiates everything from the AbstractChar class. For the moment, it only contains constructors and some default variables.
    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String defaultName 
      static int[] defaultStats 

      • Fields inherited from class entities.Entity

        dead, dying

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Char()
      The base constructor of the Char uses both default parameters to run the constructor requiring both a String and array.
      Char(int[] stats)
      This constructor takes an inputted array of stats and uses the defaultName parameter for the other part to run the constructor needing both a String an array.
      Char(java.lang.String name)
      This constructor takes an inputted name String and uses the defaultStats parameter for the other part to run the constructor needing both a String an array.
      Char(java.lang.String name, int[] stats)
      This constructor sets the name to the inputted name, then sets each of the Char's stats to their inputted values using the inputted array.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Char

        public Char()
        The base constructor of the Char uses both default parameters to run the constructor requiring both a String and array.
        See Also:
        Char(String, int[])

      • Char

        public Char(java.lang.String name)
        This constructor takes an inputted name String and uses the defaultStats parameter for the other part to run the constructor needing both a String an array.
        Parameters:
        name - The name you want the character to have.
        See Also:
        Char(String, int[])

      • Char

        public Char(int[] stats)
        This constructor takes an inputted array of stats and uses the defaultName parameter for the other part to run the constructor needing both a String an array.
        Parameters:
        stats - The array of stats for the character.
        See Also:
        Char(String, int[])

      • Char

        public Char(java.lang.String name,
            int[] stats)
        This constructor sets the name to the inputted name, then sets each of the Char's stats to their inputted values using the inputted array. It then gives the Char a new Fist and 5 HealthPotions.
        Parameters:
        name - The String to set the Char's name to.
        stats - The array of stats for the character.
        See Also:
        Char(), Char(int[]), Char(String)
